أرسله الله ليهدي قومه ويدعوهم إلى عبادة الله، وكانوا قوما ظالمين يأتون الفواحش ويعتدون على الغرباء وكانوا يأتون الرجال شهوة من دون النساء فلما دعاهم لوط لترك المنكرات أرادوا أن يخرجوه هو وقومه فلم يؤمن به غير بعض من آل بيته، أما امرأته فلم تؤمن ولما يئس لوط دعا الله أن ينجيهم ويهلك المفسدين فجاءت له الملائكة وأخرجوا لوط ومن آمن به وأهلكوا الآخرين بحجارة مسومة.

سيرته:

حال قوم لوط:

دعى لوط قومه إلى عبادة الله وحده لا شريك له، ونهاهم عن كسب السيئات والفواحش. واصطدمت دعوته بقلوب قاسية وأهواء مريضة ورفض متكبر. وحكموا على لوط وأهله بالطرد من القرية. فقد كان القوم الذين بعث إليهم لوط يرتكبون عددا كبيرا من الجرائم البشعة. كانوا يقطعون الطريق، ويخونون الرفيق، ويتواصون بالإثم، ولا يتناهون عن منكر، وقد زادوا في سجل جرائمهم جريمة لم يسبقهم بها أحد من العالمين. كانوا يأتون الرجال شهوة من دون النساء.

لقد اختلت المقاييس عند قوم لوط.. فصار الرجال أهدافا مرغوبة بدلا من النساء، وصار النقاء والطهر جريمة تستوجب الطرد.. كانوا مرضى يرفضون الشفاء ويقاومونه.. ولقد كانت تصرفات قوم لوط تحزن قلب لوط.. كانوا يرتكبون جريمتهم علانية في ناديهم.. وكانوا إذا دخل المدينة غريب أو مسافر أو ضيف لم ينقذه من أيديهم أحد.. وكانوا يقولون للوط: استضف أنت النساء ودع لنا الرجال.. واستطارت شهرتهم الوبيلة، وجاهدهم لوط جهادا عظيما، وأقام عليهم حجته، ومرت الأيام والشهور والسنوات، وهو ماض في دعوته بغير أن يؤمن له أحد.. لم يؤمن به غير أهل بيته.. حتى أهل بيته لم يؤمنوا به جميعا. كانت زوجته كافرة.

وزاد الأمر بأن قام الكفرة بالاستهزاء برسالة لوط عليه السلام، فكانوا يقولون: (ائْتِنَا بِعَذَابِ اللَّهِ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ الصَّادِقِينَ). فيئس لوط منهم، ودعا الله أن ينصره ويهلك المفسدين.

ذهاب الملائكة لقوم لوط:

خرج الملائكة من عند إبراهيم قاصدين قرية لوط.. بلغوا أسوار سدوم.. وابنة لوط واقفة تملأ وعاءها من مياه النهر.. رفعت وجهها فشاهدتهم..  فسألها أحد الملائكة: يا جارية.. هل من منزل؟

قالت [وهي تذكر قومها]: مكانكم لا تدخلوا حتى أخبر أبي وآتيكم.. أسرعت نحو أبيها فأخبرته. فهرع لوط يجري نحو الغرباء. فلم يكد يراهم حتى (سِيءَ بِهِمْ وَضَاقَ بِهِمْ ذَرْعًا وَقَالَ هَـذَا يَوْمٌ عَصِيبٌ) سألهم: من أين جاءوا؟ .. وما هي وجهتهم؟.. فصمتوا عن إجابته. وسألوه أن يضيفهم.. استحى منهم وسار أمامهم قليلا ثم توقف والتفت إليهم يقول: لا أعلم على وجه الأرض أخبث من أهل هذا البلد.

قال كلمته ليصرفهم عن المبيت في القرية، غير أنهم غضوا النظر عن قوله ولم يعلقوا عليه، وعاد يسير معهم ويلوي عنق الحديث ويقسره قسرا ويمضي به إلى أهل القرية - حدثهم أنهم خبثاء.. أنهم يخزون ضيوفهم.. حدثهم أنهم يفسدون في الأرض. وكان الصراع يجري داخله محاولا التوفيق بين أمرين.. صرف ضيوفه عن المبيت في القرية دون إحراجهم، وبغير إخلال بكرم الضيافة.. عبثا حاول إفهامهم والتلميح لهم أن يستمروا في رحلتهم، دون نزول بهذه القرية.

سقط الليل على المدينة.. صحب لوط ضيوفه إلى بيته.. لم يرهم من أهل المدينة أحد.. لم تكد زوجته تشهد الضيوف حتى تسللت خارجة بغير أن تشعره. أسرعت إلى قومها وأخبرتهم الخبر.. وانتشر الخبر مثل النار في الهشيم. وجاء قوم لوط له مسرعين.. تساءل لوط بينه وبين نفسه: من الذي أخبرهم؟.. وقف القوم على باب البيت.. خرج إليهم لوط متعلقا بأمل أخير، وبدأ بوعظهم:

(هَـؤُلاء بَنَاتِي هُنَّ أَطْهَرُ لَكُمْ).. قال لهم: أمامكم النساء -زوجاتكم- هن أطهر.. فهن يلبين الفطرة السوية.. كما أن الخالق -جلّ في علاه- قد هيّئهن لهذا الأمر.

(فَاتَّقُواْ اللّهَ).. يلمس نفوسهم من جانب التقوى بعد أن لمسها من جانب الفطرة.. اتقوا الله وتذكروا أن الله يسمع ويرى.. ويغضب ويعاقب وأجدر بالعقلاء اتقاء غضبه.

(وَلاَ تُخْزُونِ فِي ضَيْفِي).. هي محاولة يائسة لِلَمْس نخوتهم وتقاليدهم. و ينبغي عليهم إكرام الضيف لا فضحه.

(أَلَيْسَ مِنكُمْ رَجُلٌ رَّشِيدٌ).. أليس فيكم رجل عاقل؟.. إن ما تريدونه -لو تحقق- هو عين الجنون.

إلا أن كلمات لوط عليه السلام لم تلمس الفطرة المنحرفة المريضة، ولا القلب الجامد الميت، ولا العقل المريض الأحمق.. ظلت الفورة الشاذة على اندفاعها.

أحس لوط بضعفه وهو غريب بين القوم.. نازح إليهم من بعيد بغير عشيرة تحميه، ولا أولاد ذكور يدافعون عنه.. دخل لوط غاضبا وأغلق باب بيته.. كان الغرباء الذين استضافهم يجلسون هادئين صامتين.. فدهش لوط من هدوئهم.. وازدادت ضربات القوم على الباب.. وصرخ لوط في لحظة يأس خانق: (قَالَ لَوْ أَنَّ لِي بِكُمْ قُوَّةً أَوْ آوِي إِلَى رُكْنٍ شَدِيدٍ) تمنى أن تكون له قوة تصدهم عن ضيفه.. وتمنى لو كان له ركن شديد يحتمي فيه ويأوي إليه.. غاب عن لوط في شدته وكربته أنه يأوي إلى ركن شديد.. ركن الله الذي لا يتخلى عن أنبيائه وأوليائه.. قال رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم، وهو يقرأ هذه الآية: "رحمة الله على لوط.. كان يأوي إلى ركن شديد".

هلاك قوم لوط:

عندما بلغ الضيق ذروته.. وقال النبي كلمته.. تحرك ضيوفه ونهضوا فجأة.. أفهموه أنه يأوي إلى ركن شديد.. فقالوا له لا تجزع يا لوط ولا تخف.. نحن ملائكة.. ولن يصل إليك هؤلاء القوم.. ثم نهض جبريل، عليه السلام، وأشار بيده إشارة سريعة، ففقد القوم أبصارهم.

التفتت الملائكة إلى لوط وأصدروا إليه أمرهم أن يصحب أهله أثناء الليل ويخرج.. سيسمعون أصواتا مروعة تزلزل الجبال.. لا يلتفت منهم أحد.. كي لا يصيبه ما يصيب القوم.. أي عذاب هذا؟.. هو عذاب من نوع غريب، يكفي لوقوعه بالمرء مجرد النظر إليه.. أفهموه أن امرأته كانت من الغابرين.. امرأته كافرة مثلهم وستلتفت خلفها فيصيبها ما أصابهم.

سأل لوط الملائكة: أينزل الله العذاب بهم الآن.. أنبئوه أن موعدهم مع العذاب هو الصبح.. (أَلَيْسَ الصُّبْحُ بِقَرِيبٍ)؟

خرج لوط مع بناته وزوجته.. ساروا في الليل وغذوا السير.. واقترب الصبح.. كان لوط قد ابتعد مع أهله.. ثم جاء أمر الله تعالى.. قال العلماء: اقتلع جبريل، عليه السلام، بطرف جناحه مدنهم السبع من قرارها البعيد.. رفعها جميعا إلى عنان السماء حتى سمعت الملائكة أصوات ديكتهم ونباح كلابهم، قلب المدن السبع وهوى بها في الأرض.. أثناء السقوط كانت السماء تمطرهم بحجارة من الجحيم.. حجارة صلبة قوية يتبع بعضها بعضا، ومعلمة بأسمائهم، ومقدرة عليهم.. استمر الجحيم يمطرهم.. وانتهى قوم لوط تماما.. لم يعد هناك أحد.. نكست المدن على رؤوسها، وغارت في الأرض، حتى انفجر الماء من الأرض.. هلك قوم لوط ومحيت مدنهم.

كان لوط يسمع أصوات مروعة.. وكان يحاذر أن يلتفت خلفه.. نظرت زوجته نحو مصدر الصوت فانتهت.. تهرأ جسدها وتفتت مثل عمود ساقط من الملح.

قال العلماء: إن مكان المدن السبع.. بحيرة غريبة.. ماؤها أجاج.. وكثافة الماء أعظم من كثافة مياه البحر الملحة.. وفي هذه البحيرة صخور معدنية ذائبة.. توحي بأن هذه الحجارة التي ضرب بها قوم لوط كانت شهبا مشعلة. يقال إن البحيرة الحالية التي نعرفها باسم "البحر الميت" في فلسطين.. هي مدن قوم لوط السابقة.

انطوت صفحة قوم لوط.. انمحت مدنهم وأسمائهم من الأرض.. سقطوا من ذاكرة الحياة والأحياء.. وطويت صفحة من صفحات الفساد.. وتوجه لوط إلى إبراهيم.. زار إبراهيم وقص عليه نبأ قومه.. وأدهشه أن إبراهيم كان يعلم.. ومضى لوط في دعوته إلى الله.. مثلما مضى الحليم الأواه المنيب إبراهيم في دعوته إلى الله.. مضى الاثنان ينشران الإسلام في الأرض.
number-en: The story of Lot, peace be upon him
label-en:
About:

God sent him to guide his people and call them to worship God, and they were an unjust people who committed immoral acts and assaulted strangers, and they used to come to men lustfully rather than women. When Lot called on them to abandon evil things, they wanted to expel him and his people, but only some of his household believed in him. As for his wife, she did not believe. When Lot despaired, he called on God to save them and destroy the corrupters, so the angels came to him and took out Lot and those who believed in him. They destroyed others with poisoned stones.

His biography:

The condition of the people of Lot:

Lot called on his people to worship God alone, without partners, and forbade them from committing evil deeds and immoral acts. His call collided with hard hearts, sick whims, and arrogant rejection. They sentenced Lot and his family to be expelled from the village. The people to whom Lot was sent were committing a large number of heinous crimes. They were blocking the road, betraying a comrade, communicating in sin, and not refraining from evil, and they added to their record of crimes a crime that no one in the world had ever done before them. They used to come to men lusting after women.

The standards among the people of Lot were distorted. Men became desirable targets instead of women, and purity and cleanliness became a crime requiring expulsion. They were sick, they refused healing and resisted it. The actions of Lot’s people saddened Lot’s heart.. They would commit their crime openly in their club.. And when a stranger, traveler, or guest entered the city, no one would rescue him from their hands.. And they would say to Lot: You host the women and leave us the men.. And their disastrous fame spread, and Lot fought them with a mighty effort, and established his argument against them, and days, months, and years passed, and he continued in his call without anyone believing in him.. Only his family believed in him. His house.. Even his family did not believe in him at all. His wife was an infidel.

The matter increased when the infidels mocked the message of Lot, peace be upon him, and they used to say: (Bring us the punishment of God if you are of the truthful ones). Lot despaired of them, and prayed to God to grant him victory and destroy the corruptors.

The angels going to Lot’s people:

The angels left Abraham, heading to Lot's village. They reached the walls of Sodom. Lot's daughter was standing, filling her bowl with water from the river. She raised her face and saw them. One of the angels asked her: Oh maid, is there a house?

She said [while reminding her people]: Do not enter your place until I inform my father and I will come to you.. She hurried to her father and told him. Lot ran towards the strangers. No sooner had he seen them than he (he felt bad for them and fed up with them and said, “This is a difficult day”) asked them: Where did they come from? ..And what is their destination?..So they remained silent about his answer. They asked him to add them.. He was ashamed of them and walked in front of them for a while, then stopped and turned to them, saying: I do not know on the face of the earth anyone more vile than the people of this country.

He said his word to distract them from spending the night in the village, but they turned a blind eye to what he said and did not comment on it, and he went back to walking with them, twisting the neck of the conversation, forcefully forcing it, and taking it to the people of the village - he told them that they were malicious... that they were disgracing their guests... Tell them that they are making mischief on earth. The conflict was going on inside him, trying to reconcile two matters: diverting his guests from spending the night in the village without embarrassing them, and without disturbing the hospitality. In vain, he tried to understand them and hint to them to continue their journey, without coming down to this village.

Night fell on the city.. Lot accompanied his guests to his house.. None of the city’s people saw them. His wife had barely witnessed the guests before she snuck out without noticing him. She rushed to her people and told them the news...and the news spread like wild fire. Lot's people came to him quickly. Lot wondered to himself: Who told them? The people stood at the door of the house.. Lot went out to them, holding on to one last hope, and began to preach to them:

(These are my daughters. They are more pure for you.) He said to them: In front of you are the women - your wives - who are more pure.

(So ​​fear God)... He touches their souls from the side of piety after touching them from the side of nature.. Fear God and remember that God hears and sees.. and gets angry and punishes, and it is better for wise people to avoid His wrath.

(And do not disgrace me among my guests)... It is a desperate attempt to touch their chivalry and traditions. They should honor the guest, not shame him.

(Is there not a rational man among you?)... Is there not a rational man among you?.. What you want - if it comes true - is the essence of madness.

However, the words of Lot, peace be upon him, did not touch the sick, perverted nature, nor the rigid, dead heart, nor the sick, foolish mind. The abnormal outburst remained on its impulse.

Lot felt weak while he was a stranger among the people. He had migrated to them from afar, without a clan to protect him, and no male children to defend him. Lot entered angrily and closed the door of his house. The strangers he had hosted were sitting calm and silent. Lot was astonished by their calmness. And the people's blows on the door increased... and Lot shouted in a moment of suffocating despair: (He said, "If only I had strength over you or could I take refuge in a strong corner"). Shadeed...the pillar of God who does not abandon His prophets and saints.. The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said, while reading this verse: “God’s mercy be upon Lot...he used to take refuge in a severe pillar.”

The destruction of the people of Lot:

When the distress reached its peak... and the Prophet said his word... his guests suddenly moved and rose... They made him understand that he was sheltering in a harsh corner. They said to him, “Do not be alarmed, O Lot, and do not be afraid. We are angels. And these people will not reach you.” Then Gabriel, peace be upon him, got up and made a quick gesture with his hand, and the people lost their sight.

The angels turned to Lot and ordered him to accompany his family during the night and go out. They will hear horrific sounds that shake the mountains. None of them will turn around, so that what befalls the people does not happen to him. What kind of torment is this? It is a strange type of torment, enough to happen to a person just by looking at him. Make him understand that his wife was one of those who lost their lives. His wife is an infidel like them, and she will look back and what happened to them will happen to her.

Lot asked the angels: Will God inflict torment on them now? Tell him that their time with torment is dawn. (Isn’t dawn near)?

Lot went out with his daughters and his wife.. They walked at night and fed the march.. and the morning approached.. Lot had moved away with his family.. Then the command of God Almighty came.. The scholars said: Gabriel, peace be upon him, uprooted with the tip of his wing their seven cities from their far place.. He raised them all to the top of the sky until the angels heard the sounds of their roosters and the barking of their dogs. He overturned the seven cities and plunged them into the earth.. During the fall, the sky was raining stones from Hell on them... solid, strong stones following one another, marked with their names, and decreed upon them... Hell continued to rain on them... and Lot’s people were completely finished... there was no one left... the cities fell on their heads, and sank into the ground, until water burst from the ground... Lot’s people perished and their cities were wiped out.

Lot was hearing horrific sounds. He was careful not to look back. His wife looked at the source of the sound and stopped. Her body collapsed and crumbled like a fallen pillar of salt.

The scholars said: The location of the Seven Cities is a strange lake with brackish water. The density of the water is greater than the density of salt sea water... and in this lake there are melted mineral rocks... suggesting that these stones with which Lot's people were struck were flaming meteors. It is said that the current lake, which we know as the “Dead Sea” in Palestine, is the former cities of the people of Lot.

The page of Lot's people was turned.. Their cities and names were erased from the earth.. They fell from the memory of life and the living.. And a page of corruption was turned.. And Lot went to Abraham.. He visited Abraham and told him the news of his people.. He was astonished that Abraham knew.. Lot continued in his call to God.. Just as the forbearing, humble, and repentant Ibrahim continued in his call to God...the two went on to spread Islam on earth.

نبذة:

هو ابن إبراهيم البكر وولد السيدة هاجر، سار إبراهيم بهاجر - بأمر من الله - حتى وضعها وابنها في موضع مكة وتركهما ومعهما قليل من الماء والتمر ولما نفد الزاد جعلت السيدة هاجر تطوف هنا وهناك حتى هداها الله إلى ماء زمزم ووفد عليها كثير من الناس حتى جاء أمر الله لسيدنا إبراهيم ببناء الكعبة ورفع قواعد البيت، فجعل إسماعيل يأتي بالحجر وإبراهيم يبني حتى أتما البناء ثم جاء أمر الله بذبح إسماعيل حيث رأى إبراهيم في منامه أنه يذبح ابنه فعرض عليه ذلك فقال "يا أبت افعل ما تؤمر ستجدني إن شاء الله من الصابرين" ففداه الله بذبح عظيم، كان إسماعيل فارسا فهو أول من استأنس الخيل وكان صبورا حليما، يقال إنه أول من تحدث بالعربية البينة وكان صادق الوعد، وكان يأمر أهله بالصلاة والزكاة، وكان ينادي بعبادة الله ووحدانيته.

سيرته:

الاختبار الأول:

ذكر الله في كتابه الكريم، ثلاث مشاهد من حياة إسماعيل عليه السلام. كل مشهد عبارة عن محنة واختبار لكل من إبراهيم وإسماعيل عليهما السلام. أول هذه المشاهد هو أمر الله سبحانه وتعالى لإبراهيم بترك إسماعيل وأمه في واد مقفر، لا ماء فيه ولا طعام. فما كان من إبراهيم عليه السلام إلا الاستجابة لهذا الأمر الرباني. وهذا بخلاف ما ورد في الإسرائيليات من أن إبراهيم حمل ابنه وزوجته لوادي مكة لأن سارة -زوجة إبراهيم الأولى- اضطرته لذلك من شدة غيرتها من هاجر. فالمتأمل لسيرة إبراهيم عليه السلام، سيجد أنه لم يكن ليتلقّى أوامره من أحد غير الله.

أنزل زوجته وابنه وتركهما هناك، ترك معهما جرابا فيه بعض الطعام، وقليلا من الماء. ثم استدار وتركهما وسار.

أسرعت خلفه زوجته وهي تقول له: يا إبراهيم أين تذهب وتتركنا بهذا الوادي الذي ليس فيه شيء؟

لم يرد عليها سيدنا إبراهيم وظل يسير.. عادت تقول له ما قالته وهو صامت.. أخيرا فهمت أنه لا يتصرف هكذا من نفسه.. أدركت أن الله أمره بذلك فسألته: هل الله أمرك بهذا؟

فقال إبراهيم عليه السلام: نعم.

قالت زوجته المؤمنة العظيمة: لن نضيع ما دام الله معنا وهو الذي أمرك بهذا.

وسار إبراهيم حتى إذا أخفاه جبل عنهما وقف ورفع يديه الكريمتين إلى السماء وراح يدعو الله:

رَّبَّنَا إِنِّي أَسْكَنتُ مِن ذُرِّيَّتِي بِوَادٍ غَيْرِ ذِي زَرْعٍ عِندَ بَيْتِكَ الْمُحَرَّمِ رَبَّنَا لِيُقِيمُواْ الصَّلاَةَ فَاجْعَلْ أَفْئِدَةً مِّنَ النَّاسِ تَهْوِي إِلَيْهِمْ وَارْزُقْهُم مِّنَ الثَّمَرَاتِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَشْكُرُونَ (37) (إبراهيم)

لم يكن بيت الله قد أعيد بناؤه بعد، لم تكن الكعبة قد بنيت، وكانت هناك حكمة عليا في أمر الله سبحانه لإبراهيم، فقد كان إسماعيل -الطفل الذي تُرِكَ مع أمه في هذا المكان- ووالده من سيكونان المسؤولان بناء الكعبة فيما بعد.. وكانت حكمة الله تقضي أن يسكن أحد في هذا الوادي، لميتد إليه العمران.

بعد أن ترك إبراهيم زوجته وابنه الرضيع في الصحراء بأيام نفد الماء وانتهى الطعام، وجف لبن الأم.. وأحست هاجر وإسماعيل بالعطش.

بدأ إسماعيل يبكي من العطش.. فتركته أمه وانطلقت تبحث عن ماء.. راحت تمشي مسرعة حتى وصلت إلى جبل اسمه "الصفا".. فصعدت إليه وراحت تبحث به عن بئر أو إنسان أو قافلة.. لم يكن هناك شيء. ونزلت مسرعة من الصفا حتى إذا وصلت إلى الوادي راحت تسعى سعي الإنسان المجهد حتى جاوزت الوادي ووصلت إلى جبل "المروة"، فصعدت إليه ونظرت لترى أحدا لكنها لم تر أحدا. وعادت الأم إلى طفلها فوجدته يبكي وقد اشتد عطشه.. وأسرعت إلى الصفا فوقفت عليه، وهرولت إلى المروة فنظرت من فوقه.. وراحت تذهب وتجيء سبع مرات بين الجبلين الصغيرين.. سبع مرات وهي تذهب وتعود - ولهذا يذهب الحجاج سبع مرات ويعودون بين الصفا والمروة إحياء لذكريات أمهم الأولى ونبيهم العظيم إسماعيل. عادت هاجر بعد المرة السابعة وهي مجهدة متعبة تلهث.. وجلست بجوار ابنها الذي كان صوته قد بح من البكاء والعطش.

وفي هذه اللحظة اليائسة أدركتها رحمة الله، وضرب إسماعيل بقدمه الأرض وهو يبكي فانفجرت تحت قدمه بئر زمزم.. وفار الماء من البئر.. أنقذت حياتا الطفل والأم.. راحت الأم تغرف بيدها وهي تشكر الله.. وشربت وسقت طفلها وبدأت الحياة تدب في المنطقة.. صدق ظنها حين قالت: لن نضيع ما دام الله معنا.

وبدأت بعض القوافل تستقر في المنطقة.. وجذب الماء الذي انفجر من بئر زمزم عديدا من الناس.. وبدأ العمران يبسط أجنحته على المكان.

كانت هذه هي المحنة الاولى.. أما المحنة الثانية فهي الذبح.

الاختبار الثاني:

كبر إسماعيل.. وتعلق به قلب إبراهيم.. جاءه العقب على كبر فأحبه.. وابتلى الله تعالى إبراهيم بلاء عظيما بسبب هذا الحب. فقد رأى إبراهيم عليه السلام في المنام أنه يذبح ابنه الوحيد إسماعيل. وإبراهيم يعمل أن رؤيا الأنبياء وحي.

انظر كيف يختبر الله عباده. تأمل أي نوع من أنواع الاختبار. نحن أمام نبي قلبه أرحم قلب في الأرض. اتسع قلبه لحب الله وحب من خلق. جاءه ابن على كبر.. وقد طعن هو في السن ولا أمل هناك في أن ينجب. ثم ها هو ذا يستسلم للنوم فيرى في المنام أنه يذبح ابنه وبكره ووحيده الذي ليس له غيره.

أي نوع من الصراع نشب في نفسه. يخطئ من يظن أن صراعا لم ينشأ قط. لا يكون بلاء مبينا هذا الموقف الذي يخلو من الصراع. نشب الصراع في نفس إبراهيم.. صراع أثارته عاطفة الأبوة الحانية. لكن إبراهيم لم يسأل عن السبب وراء ذبح ابنه. فليس إبراهيم من يسأل ربه عن أوامره.

فكر إبراهيم في ولده.. ماذا يقول عنه إذا أرقده على الأرض ليذبحه.. الأفضل أن يقول لولده ليكون ذلك أطيب لقلبه وأهون عليه من أن يأخذه قهرا ويذبحه قهرا. هذا أفضل.. انتهى الأمر وذهب إلى ولده (قَالَ يَا بُنَيَّ إِنِّي أَرَى فِي الْمَنَامِ أَنِّي أَذْبَحُكَ فَانظُرْ مَاذَا تَرَى). انظر إلى تلطفه في إبلاغ ولده، وترك الأمر لينظر فيه الابن بالطاعة.. إن الأمر مقضي في نظر إبراهيم لأنه وحي من ربه.. فماذا يرى الابن الكريم في ذلك؟ أجاب إسماعيل: هذا أمر يا أبي فبادر بتنفيذه (يَا أَبَتِ افْعَلْ مَا تُؤْمَرُ سَتَجِدُنِي إِن شَاء اللَّهُ مِنَ الصَّابِرِينَ). تأمل رد الابن.. إنسان يعرف أنه سيذبح فيمتثل للأمر الإلهي ويقدم المشيئة ويطمئن والده أنه سيجده (إِن شَاء اللَّهُ مِنَ الصَّابِرِينَ). هو الصبر على أي حال وعلى كل حال.. وربما استعذب الابن أن يموت ذبحا بأمر من الله.. ها هو ذا إبراهيم يكتشف أن ابنه ينافسه في حب الله. لا نعرف أي مشاعر جاشت في نفس إبراهيم بعد استسلام ابنه الصابر.

ينقلنا الحق نقلة خاطفة فإذا إسماعيل راقد على الأرض، وجهه في الأرض رحمة به كيلا يرى نفسه وهو يذبح. وإذا إبراهيم يرفع يده بالسكين.. وإذا أمر الله مطاع. (فَلَمَّا أَسْلَمَا) استخدم القرآن هذا التعبير.. (فَلَمَّا أَسْلَمَا) هذا هو الإسلام الحقيقي.. تعطي كل شيء، فلا يتبقى منك شيء.

عندئذ فقط.. وفي اللحظة التي كان السكين فيها يتهيأ لإمضاء أمره.. نادى الله إبراهيم.. انتهى اختباره، وفدى الله إسماعيل بذبح عظيم - وصار اليوم عيدا لقوم لم يولدوا بعد، هم المسلمون. صارت هذه اللحظات عيدا للمسلمين. عيدا يذكرهم بمعنى الإسلام الحقيقي الذي كان عليه إبراهيم وإسماعيل.

خبر زوجة إسماعيل:

عاش إسماعيل في شبه الجزيرة العربية ما شاء الله له أن يعيش.. روض الخيل واستأنسها واستخدمها، وساعدت مياه زمزم على سكنى المنطقة وتعميرها. استقرت بها بعض القوافل.. وسكنتها القبائل.. وكبر إسماعيل وتزوج، وزاره إبراهيم فلم يجده في بيته ووجد امرأته.. سألها عن عيشهم وحالهم، فشكت إليه من الضيق والشدة.

قال لها إبراهيم: إذا جاء زوجك مريه أن يغير عتبة بابه.. فلما جاء إسماعيل، ووصفت له زوجته الرجل.. قال: هذا أبي وهو يأمرني بفراقك.. الحقي بأهلك.

وتزوج إسماعيل امرأة ثانية.. زارها إبراهيم، يسألها عن حالها، فحدثته أنهم في نعمة وخير.. وطاب صدر إبراهيم بهذه الزوجة لابنه.

الاختبار الثالث:

وها نحن الآن أمام الاختبار الثالث.. اختبار لا يمس إبراهيم وإسماعيل فقط. بل يمس ملايين البشر من بعدهم إلى يوم القيامة.. إنها مهمة أوكلها الله تعالى لهذين النبيين الكريمين.. مهمة بناء بيت الله تعالى في الأرض.

كبر إسماعيل.. وبلغ أشده.. وجاءه إبراهيم وقال له: يا إسماعيل.. إن الله أمرني بأمر. قال إسماعيل: فاصنع ما أمرك به ربك.. قال إبراهيم: وتعينني؟ قال: وأعينك. فقال إبراهيم: فإن الله أمرني أن ابني هنا بيتا. أشار بيده لصحن منخفض هناك.

صدر الأمر ببناء بيت الله الحرام.. هو أول بيت وضع للناس في الأرض.. وهو أول بيت عبد فيه الإنسان ربه.. ولما كان آدم هو أول إنسان هبط إلى الأرض.. فإليه يرجع فضل بنائه أول مرة.. قال العلماء: إن آدم بناه وراح يطوف حوله مثلما يطوف الملائكة حول عرش الله تعالى.

بنى آدم خيمة يعبد فيها الله.. شيء طبيعي أن يبني آدم -بوصفه نبيا- بيتا لعبادة ربه.. وحفت الرحمة بهذا المكان.. ثم مات آدم ومرت القرون، وطال عليه العهد فضاع أثر البيت وخفي مكانه.. وها هو ذا إبراهيم يتلقى الأمر ببنائه مرة ثانية.. ليظل في المرة الثانية قائما إلى يوم القيامة إن شاء الله. وبدأ بناء الكعبة..

هدمت الكعبة في التاريخ أكثر من مرة، وكان بناؤها يعاد في كل مرة.. فهي باقية منذ عهد إبراهيم إلى اليوم.. وحين بعث رسول الله، صلى الله عليه وسلم، تحقيقا لدعوة إبراهيم.. وجد الرسول الكعبة حيث بنيت آخر مرة، وقد قصر الجهد بمن بناها فلم يحفر أساسها كما حفره إبراهيم.

نفهم من هذا إن إبراهيم وإسماعيل بذلا فيها وحدهما جهدا استحالت -بعد ذلك- محاكاته على عدد كبير من الرجال.. ولقد صرح الرسول بأنه يحب هدمها وإعادتها إلى أساس إبراهيم، لولا قرب عهد القوم بالجاهلية، وخشيته أن يفتن الناس هدمها وبناؤها من جديد.. بناؤها بحيث تصل إلى قواعد إبراهيم وإسماعيل.

أي جهد شاق بذله النبيان الكريمان وحدهما؟ كان عليهما حفر الأساس لعمق غائر في الأرض، وكان عليهما قطع الحجارة من الجبال البعيدة والقريبة، ونقلها بعد ذلك، وتسويتها، وبناؤها وتعليتها.. وكان الأمر يستوجب جهد جيل من الرجال، ولكنهما بنياها معا.

لا نعرف كم هو الوقت الذي استغرقه بناء الكعبة، كما نجهل الوقت الذي استغرقه بناء سفينة نوح، المهم أن سفينة نوح والكعبة كانتا معا ملاذا للناس ومثوبة وأمنا.. والكعبة هي سفينة نوح الثابتة على الأرض أبدا.. وهي تنتظر الراغبين في النجاة من هول الطوفان دائما.

لم يحدثنا الله عن زمن بناء الكعبة.. حدثنا عن أمر أخطر وأجدى.. حدثنا عن تجرد نفسية من كان يبنيها.. ودعائه وهو يبنيها:

وَإِذْ يَرْفَعُ إِبْرَاهِيمُ الْقَوَاعِدَ مِنَ الْبَيْتِ وَإِسْمَاعِيلُ رَبَّنَا تَقَبَّلْ مِنَّا إِنَّكَ أَنتَ السَّمِيعُ الْعَلِيمُ (127) رَبَّنَا وَاجْعَلْنَا مُسْلِمَيْنِ لَكَ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّتِنَا أُمَّةً مُّسْلِمَةً لَّكَ وَأَرِنَا مَنَاسِكَنَا وَتُبْ عَلَيْنَا إِنَّكَ أَنتَ التَّوَّابُ الرَّحِيمُ (128) رَبَّنَا وَابْعَثْ فِيهِمْ رَسُولاً مِّنْهُمْ يَتْلُو عَلَيْهِمْ آيَاتِكَ وَيُعَلِّمُهُمُ الْكِتَابَ وَالْحِكْمَةَ وَيُزَكِّيهِمْ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ العَزِيزُ الحَكِيمُ (129) (البقرة)

إن أعظم مسلمين على وجه الأرض يومها يدعوان الله أن يتقبل عملهما، وأن يجعلهما مسلمين له.. يعرفان أن القلوب بين إصبعين من أصابع الرحمن. وتبلغ الرحمة بهما أن يسألا الله أن يخرج من ذريتهما أمة مسلمة له سبحانه.. يريدان أن يزيد عدد العابدين الموجودين والطائفين والركع السجود. إن دعوة إبراهيم وإسماعيل تكشف عن اهتمامات القلب المؤمن.. إنه يبني لله بيته، ومع هذا يشغله أمر العقيدة.. ذلك إيحاء بأن البيت رمز العقيدة. ثم يدعوان الله أن يريهم أسلوب العبادة الذي يرضاه، وأن يتوب عليهم فهو التواب الرحيم. بعدها يتجاوز اهتمامها هذا الزمن الذي يعيشان فيه.. يجاوزانه ويدعوان الله أن يبث رسولا لهؤلاء البشر. وتحققت هذه الدعوة الأخيرة.. حين بعث محمد بن عبد الله، صلى الله عليه وسلم.. تحققت بعد أزمنة وأزمنة.

انتهى بناء البيت، وأراد إبراهيم حجرا مميزا، يكون علامة خاصة يبدأ منها الطواف حول الكعبة.. أمر إبراهيم إسماعيل أن يأتيه بحجر مميز يختلف عن لون حجارة الكعبة.

سار إسماعيل ملبيا أمر والده.. حين عاد، كان إبراهيم قد وضع الحجر الأسود في مكانه.. فسأله إسماعيل: من الذي أحضره إليك يا أبت؟ فأجاب إبراهيم: أحضره جبريل عليه السلام.

انتهى بناء الكعبة.. وبدأ طواف الموحدين والمسلمين حولها.. ووقف إبراهيم يدعو ربه نفس دعائه من قبل.. أن يجعل أَفْئِدَةً مِّنَ النَّاسِ تَهْوِي إلى المكان.. انظر إلى التعبير.. إن الهوى يصور انحدارا لا يقاوم نحو شيء.. وقمة ذلك هوى الكعبة. من هذه الدعوة ولد الهوى العميق في نفوس المسلمين، رغبة في زيارة البيت الحرام.

وصار كل من يزور المسجد الحرام ويعود إلى بلده.. يحس أنه يزداد عطشا كلما ازداد ريا منه، ويعمق حنينه إليه كلما بعد منه، وتجيء أوقات الحج في كل عام.. فينشب الهوى الغامض أظافره في القلب نزوعا إلى رؤية البيت، وعطشا إلى بئر زمزم.

قال تعالى حين جادل المجادلون في إبراهيم وإسماعيل.

مَا كَانَ إِبْرَاهِيمُ يَهُودِيًّا وَلاَ نَصْرَانِيًّا وَلَكِن كَانَ حَنِيفًا مُّسْلِمًا وَمَا كَانَ مِنَ الْمُشْرِكِينَ (67) (آل عمران)

عليه الصلاة والسلام.. استجاب الله دعاءه.. وكان إبراهيم أول من سمانا المسلمين.
number-en: The story of Ishmael, peace be upon him
label-en:
About:

He is Abraham's firstborn son and the son of Mrs. Hajar. Abraham walked with Hajar - by God's command - until he placed her and her son in the place of Mecca, leaving them with a little water and dates. When the provisions ran out, Mrs. Hajar made her walk around here and there until God guided her to the water of Zamzam, and many people came to her until God's command came to our master Abraham to build the Kaaba and raise the foundations of the House. So Ishmael began to bring the stone and Abraham built until he completed the building. Then God’s command came to slaughter Ishmael, as Abraham saw in his dream that he was slaughtering his son, so he offered it to him and said, “O my father, do as you are commanded. You will find me, God willing, among the patient ones.” So God ransomed him with a great sacrifice. Ismail was a horseman, as he was the first to tame horses and he was patient and forbearing. It is said that he was the first to speak clear Arabic and he was true to his promise, and he used to command his family. Through prayer and zakat, he called for the worship of God and His oneness.

His biography:

First test:

In his Holy Book, God mentioned three scenes from the life of Ishmael, peace be upon him. Every scene is an ordeal and test for both Abraham and Ishmael, peace be upon them. The first of these scenes is God Almighty’s command to Abraham to leave Ishmael and his mother in a desolate valley, with no water or food. Abraham, peace be upon him, had no choice but to respond to this divine command. This is contrary to what was reported in the Israelites that Abraham carried his son and his wife to the Mecca Valley because Sarah - Abraham’s first wife - forced him to do so because of her extreme jealousy of Hagar. Anyone who contemplates the biography of Abraham, peace be upon him, will find that he would not have received his orders from anyone other than God.

He took his wife and son down and left them there. He left with them a bag containing some food and a little water. Then he turned, left them, and walked away.

His wife rushed after him and said to him: O Ibrahim, where are you going and leaving us in this valley where there is nothing?

Our master Ibrahim did not respond to her and kept walking. She told him what she said again, but he was silent. Finally, I understood that he did not act like this on his own. I realized that God had commanded him to do this, so I asked him: Did God command you to do this?

Ibrahim, peace be upon him, said: Yes.

His great believing wife said: We will not be lost as long as God is with us and He is the one who commanded you to do this.

Abraham walked until a mountain hid him from them. He stopped and raised his generous hands to the sky and began to pray to God:

Our Lord, I have settled some of my descendants in a valley uncultivated by Your Sacred House, our Lord, so that they may establish prayer, so cause the hearts of the people to yearn towards them. And provide them with fruits that they may be grateful (37) (Ibrahim m)

The House of God had not yet been rebuilt, the Kaaba had not been built, and there was a supreme wisdom in God Almighty’s command to Abraham. It was Ishmael - the child who was left with his mother in this place - and his father who would be responsible for building the Kaaba later... And God’s wisdom required that someone should live in this valley, so that development would extend to it.

A few days after Abraham left his wife and infant son in the desert, the water ran out, the food ran out, and the mother’s milk dried up... and Hagar and Ishmael felt thirsty.

Ismail started crying from thirst.. so his mother left him and went looking for water.. She started walking quickly until she reached a mountain called Al-Safa. She climbed up to it and searched for a well, a person, or a caravan. There was nothing there. She quickly descended from Al-Safa until she reached the valley and began to run as hard as a human being would, until she crossed the valley and reached Mount Al-Marwah. She ascended to it and looked to see anyone, but she did not see anyone. The mother returned to her child and found him crying and very thirsty. She hurried to Al-Safa and stood on it, then she ran to Al-Marwah and looked over him. She went back and forth seven times between the two small mountains. Seven times it goes and returns - This is why pilgrims go seven times and return between Safa and Marwah in commemoration of the memories of their first mother and their great prophet Ismail. Hajar returned after the seventh time, exhausted, tired, and panting. She sat next to her son, whose voice was hoarse from crying and thirst.

At this desperate moment, God’s mercy overtook her. Ismail hit the ground with his foot while crying, and the Zamzam well exploded under his foot. Water sprang from the well. The lives of the child and the mother were saved. The mother began scooping with her hand while thanking God. She drank and gave her child water, and life began to creep into the area. Her thoughts were true when she said: We will not be lost as long as God is with us.

Some caravans began to settle in the area... and the water that exploded from the Zamzam well attracted many people... and urbanization began to spread its wings over the place.

This was the first ordeal. The second ordeal was slaughter.

Second test:

Ishmael grew up...and Abraham's heart became attached to him...a camel came to him as he grew up and he loved him...and God Almighty tested Abraham with a great trial because of this love. Abraham, peace be upon him, saw in a dream that he was slaughtering his only son, Ishmael. Abraham believed that the vision of the prophets was a revelation.

See how God tests His servants. Consider any type of test. We are before a prophet whose heart is the most merciful on earth. His heart expanded to love God and love His creation. A son came to him when he was old. He was very old and there was no hope of having a son. Then, here he was, succumbing to sleep and seeing in a dream that he was slaughtering his son, his firstborn, and his only son, who had no one but him.

What kind of conflict arose within himself. Anyone who thinks that a conflict never arose is mistaken. This situation is devoid of conflict. A conflict broke out in Ibrahim's soul...a conflict sparked by his tender fatherly affection. But Ibrahim did not ask about the reason behind slaughtering his son. Abraham is not the one who asks his Lord about His commands.

Ibrahim thought about his son.. What would he say about him if he laid him on the ground to slaughter him? It is better for him to say to his son so that it would be better for his heart and easier for him than for him to take him by force and slaughter him by force. This is better.. The matter ended and he went to his son (he said, “O my son, I see in a dream that I am slaughtering you, so see what you see.”) Look at his kindness in informing his son, and leaving the matter for the son to consider in obedience.. The matter is decided in the eyes of Abraham because it is a revelation from his Lord.. What does the honorable son see in this? Ismail replied: This is an order, my father, so hasten to implement it (O my father, do what you are commanded. You will find me, God willing, among those who are patient). Consider the son’s response: a person who knows that he will be slaughtered, so he complies with the divine command, submits the will, and reassures his father that he will find him (God willing, among those who are patient). It is patience in any case and in every situation.. And perhaps the son found it difficult to die slaughtered by order of God.. Here is Abraham discovering that his son is competing with him in the love of God. We do not know of any feelings that ran through Ibrahim’s soul after his patient son surrendered.

The truth brings us a fleeting moment, and Ismail was lying on the ground, with his face in the ground out of mercy, so that he would not see himself being slaughtered. And when Abraham raises his hand with a knife... and if God commands, he is obeyed. (So ​​when they both converted to Islam) The Qur’an used this expression... (So when they both converted to Islam) This is the true Islam... You give everything, and nothing is left of you.

Only then... and at the moment when the knife was preparing to carry out His command... God called to Abraham... His test ended, and God ransomed Ishmael with a great sacrifice - and the day became a holiday for a people who were not yet born, the Muslims. These moments have become a holiday for Muslims. A holiday that reminds them of the true meaning of Islam that Abraham and Ishmael had.

News of Ismail’s wife:

Ismail lived in the Arabian Peninsula as long as God wished for him to live. He tamed, domesticated and used horses, and the waters of Zamzam helped populate and develop the region. Some caravans settled there... and tribes inhabited it... and Ismail grew up and got married, and Abraham visited him but did not find him in his house and found his wife... He asked her about their life and their condition, and she complained to him about her distress and distress.

Ibrahim said to her: If your husband comes, tell him to change the threshold of his door. When Ismail came and his wife described the man to him, he said: This is my father, and he is ordering me to leave you. Go to your family.

Ismail married a second woman. Ibrahim visited her and asked her about her condition, so she told him that they were blessed and well. Ibrahim was pleased with this wife for his son.

Third test:

And here we are now facing the third test... a test that does not only affect Abraham and Ishmael. Rather, it will affect millions of people after them until the Day of Resurrection. It is a mission that God Almighty entrusted to these two noble prophets...the mission of building the House of God Almighty on earth.

Ishmael grew up... and reached his maturity... and Abraham came to him and said to him: O Ishmael... God has commanded me to do something. Ismail said: So do what your Lord has commanded you to do.. Abraham said: And will you help me? He said: And your eyes. Abraham said: God commanded me to build a house here. He gestured with his hand to a low plate there.

The command was issued to build the Sacred House of God. It is the first house placed for people on earth. It is the first house in which man worshiped his Lord. And since Adam was the first man to descend to earth, to Him is due the credit for building it the first time. Scientists said: Adam built it and began to circle around it just as the angels circle around the throne of God Almighty.

Adam built a tent in which he worshiped God. It was a natural thing for Adam - as a prophet - to build a house to worship his Lord. And mercy prevailed over this place. Then Adam died, and centuries passed, and his covenant became prolonged, so traces of the house were lost and its location was hidden. And here is Abraham receiving the command to build it a second time.. so that it will remain standing the second time until the Day of Resurrection, God willing. The construction of the Kaaba began.

The Kaaba was demolished more than once in history, and it was rebuilt every time. It has remained since the time of Abraham until today. When the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, was sent to fulfill Abraham’s call, the Messenger found the Kaaba where it had been built the last time. The effort of those who built it was limited and he did not dig its foundation as Abraham had dug it.

We understand from this that Abraham and Ishmael alone exerted an effort in it that was impossible - after that - to be emulated by a large number of men.. The Messenger declared that he would like to demolish it and return it to the foundation of Abraham, had it not been for the imminence of the people’s era of ignorance, and for his fear that people would be tempted by demolishing it and rebuilding it again.. Built it so that it reaches the foundations of Abraham and Ishmael.

What hard effort did the two noble prophets exert alone? They had to dig the foundation deep into the ground, and they had to cut stones from mountains far and near, and then move them, level them, build them, and raise them... It required the effort of a generation of men, but they built it together.

We do not know how long it took to build the Kaaba, just as we do not know how long it took to build Noah’s Ark. What is important is that Noah’s Ark and the Kaaba together were a refuge for people, a reward, and a security. The Kaaba is Noah’s ark that is fixed to the earth forever. It is always waiting for those who wish to escape from the horror of the flood.

God did not tell us about the time of building the Kaaba. He told us about something more dangerous and more useful. He told us about the detachment of the soul of the one who was building it.. and his prayers while he was building it:

And when Abraham raised the foundations of the House, and Ishmael, “Our Lord, accept it from us. Indeed, You are the Hearing, the Knowing (127) Our Lord, and make us submissive to You.” And from our descendants is a nation that has submitted to You, and show us our rituals, and accept our repentance. Indeed, You are the Accepting, the Most Merciful. (128) Our Lord, and send A messenger from among them will be sent to them, reciting to them Your revelations, teaching them the Book and wisdom, and purifying them. Indeed, it is You, the Mighty, the Wise. (129) (Al-Baqarah)

The two greatest Muslims on the face of the earth at that time prayed to God to accept their work and to make them submit to Him. They knew that hearts were between two of the Most Merciful’s fingers. Their mercy extends to the point that they ask God to produce from their descendants a nation Muslim to Him, Glory be to Him. They want to increase the number of existing worshipers, those who circle around, and those who kneel and prostrate. The call of Abraham and Ishmael reveals the concerns of the believing heart. He builds his house for God, and yet he is preoccupied with the matter of belief... This is an indication that the house is a symbol of belief. Then they pray to God to show them the method of worship that pleases Him, and to repent of them, for He is the Most Merciful. Then her interest goes beyond this time in which they live.. They go beyond it and pray to God to send a messenger to these people. This last call was fulfilled... when Muhammad bin Abdullah, may God bless him and grant him peace, was sent. It was fulfilled after many times and times.

The construction of the house was completed, and Ibrahim wanted a distinctive stone, which would be a special marker from which the circumambulation around the Kaaba would begin. Ibrahim ordered Ismail to bring him a distinctive stone that differed from the color of the stones of the Kaaba.

Ismail walked, obeying his father’s command. When he returned, Ibrahim had placed the Black Stone in its place. Ismail asked him: Who brought it to you, father? Abraham replied: Gabriel, peace be upon him, brought him.

The construction of the Kaaba was completed... and the circumambulation of the monotheists and Muslims began around it... and Abraham stood praying to his Lord the same supplication he had done before... to make the hearts of some people yearn for the place... look at the expression... passion depicts an irresistible descent towards something... and the pinnacle of that is the passion for the Kaaba. From this invitation, a deep desire was born in the hearts of Muslims, a desire to visit the Sacred House.

Everyone who visits the Sacred Mosque and returns to his country begins to feel that he is getting thirstier the more he waters it, and his longing for it deepens the farther he is from it. The times of Hajj come every year... and the mysterious passion drives its nails into the heart with a desire to see the House and a thirst for the Well of Zamzam.

God Almighty said when the disputants argued about Abraham and Ishmael. Abraham was neither a Jew nor a Christian, but he was an upright Muslim, and he was not of the polytheists (67) (Al Imran)

May God’s prayers and peace be upon him.. God answered his prayers.. Abraham was the first to name us Muslims.

هو ولد سيدنا إبراهيم من زوجته سارة، وقد كانت البشارة بمولده من الملائكة لإبراهيم وسارة لما مروا بهم مجتازين ذاهبين إلى مدائن قوم لوط ليدمروها عليهم لكفرهم وفجورهم، ذكره الله في القرآن بأنه "غلام عليم" جعله الله نبيا يهدي الناس إلى فعل الخيرات، جاء من نسله سيدنا يعقوب.

سيرته:

لا يذكر القرآن الكريم غير ومضات سريعة عن قصة إسحاق.. كان ميلاده حدثا خارقا، بشرت به الملائكة، وورد في البشرى اسم ابنه يعقوب.. وقد جاء ميلاده بعد سنوات من ولادة أخيه إسماعيل.. ولقد قر قلب سارة بمولد إسحق ومولد ابنه يعقوب، عليهما الصلاة والسلام.. غير أننا لا نعرف كيف كانت حياة إسحق، ولا نعرف بماذا أجابه قومه.. كل ما نعرفه أن الله أثنى عليه كنبي من الصالحين.
number-en: The story of Isaac, peace be upon him
label-en:
About:

He is the son of our master Abraham and his wife Sarah. The good news of his birth was from the angels to Abraham and Sarah when they passed by, going to the cities of the people of Lot to destroy them for their disbelief and immorality. God mentioned him in the Qur’an as a “knowing boy.” God made him a prophet who would guide people to do good deeds. From his descendants came our master Jacob.

His biography:

The Holy Qur’an only mentions quick glimpses of the story of Isaac. His birth was a miraculous event, announced by the angels, and the name of his son Jacob was mentioned in the good news. His birth came years after the birth of his brother Ishmael. Sarah’s heart warmed to the birth of Isaac and the birth of his son Jacob, may peace and blessings be upon them. However, we do not know what Isaac’s life was like, nor do we know what his people answered him with. All we know is that God praised him as a prophet. The righteous.

نبذة:

ابن إسحاق يقال له "إسرائيل" وتعني عبد الله، كان نبيا لقومه، وكان تقيا وبشرت به الملائكة جده إبراهيم وزوجته سارة عليهما السلام وهو والد يوسف.

سيرته:

هو يعقوب بن إسحاق بن إبراهيم.. اسمه إسرائيل.. كان نبيا إلى قومه.. ذكر الله تعالى ثلاث أجزاء من قصته.. بشارة ميلاده.. وقد بشر الملائكة به إبراهيم جده.. وسارة جدته.. أيضا ذكر الله تعالى وصيته عند وفاته.. وسيذكره الله فيما بعد -بغير إشارة لاسمه- في قصة يوسف.

نعرف مقدار تقواه من هذه الإشارة السريعة إلى وفاته.. نعلم أن الموت كارثة تدهم الإنسان، فلا يذكر غير همه ومصيبته.. غير أن يعقوب لا ينسى وهو يموت أن يدعو إلى ربه.. قال تعالى في سورة (البقرة):

أَمْ كُنتُمْ شُهَدَاء إِذْ حَضَرَ يَعْقُوبَ الْمَوْتُ إِذْ قَالَ لِبَنِيهِ مَا تَعْبُدُونَ مِن بَعْدِي قَالُواْ نَعْبُدُ إِلَـهَكَ وَإِلَـهَ آبَائِكَ إِبْرَاهِيمَ وَإِسْمَاعِيلَ وَإِسْحَاقَ إِلَـهاً وَاحِداً وَنَحْنُ لَهُ مُسْلِمُونَ (133) (البقرة)

إن هذا المشهد بين يعقوب وبنيه في ساعة الموت ولحظات الاحتضار، مشهد عظيم الدلالة.. نحن أمام ميت يحتضر.. ما القضية التي تشغل باله في ساعة الاحتضار..؟ ما الأفكار التي تعبر ذهنه الذي يتهيأ للانزلاق مع سكرات الموت..؟ ما الأمر الخطير الذي يريد أن يطمئن عليه قبل موته..؟ ما التركة التي يريد أن يخلفها لأبنائه وأحفاده..؟ ما الشيء الذي يريد أن يطمئن -قبل موته- على سلامة وصوله للناس.. كل الناس..؟

ستجد الجواب عن هذه الأسئلة كلها في سؤاله (مَا تَعْبُدُونَ مِن بَعْدِي). هذا ما يشغله ويؤرقه ويحرص عليه في سكرات الموت.. قضية الإيمان بالله. هي القضية الأولى والوحيدة، وهي الميراث الحقيقي الذي لا ينخره السوس ولا يفسده.. وهي الذخر والملاذ.

قال أبناء إسرائيل: نعبد إلهك وإله آبائك إبراهيم وإسماعيل وإسحاق إلها واحدا، ونحن له مسلمون.. والنص قاطع في أنهم بعثوا على الإسلام.. إن خرجوا عنه، خرجوا من رحمة الله.. وإن ظلوا فيه، أدركتهم الرحمة.

مات يعقوب وهو يسأل أبناءه عن الإسلام، ويطمئن على عقيدتهم.. وقبل موته، ابتلي بلاء شديدا في ابنه يوسف.

سترد معنا مشاهد من قصة يعقوب عليه السلام عند ذكرنا لقصة ابنه النبي الكريم يوسف عليه السلام.
number-en: The story of Jacob, peace be upon him
label-en:
About:

Ibn Ishaq is called "Israel", which means Abdullah. He was a prophet to his people, he was pious, and the angels announced him to his grandfather Abraham and his wife Sarah, peace be upon them. He is the father of Joseph.

His biography:

He is Jacob bin Ishaq bin Abraham. His name is Israel. He was a prophet to his people. God Almighty mentioned three parts of his story: the good news of his birth. The angels announced him to Abraham, his grandfather, and Sarah, his grandmother. God Almighty also mentioned his will upon his death. God will remember him later - without mentioning his name - in the story of Joseph.

We know the extent of his piety from this quick reference to his death. We know that death is a catastrophe that overwhelms a person, so that he remembers nothing but his worry and calamity. However, Jacob does not forget, as he dies, to call to his Lord.. God Almighty said in Surah (Al-Baqarah):

Or were you witnesses when death approached Jacob, when he said to his sons, “What will you worship after me?” They said, “We will worship your God and the God of your fathers, Abraham.” Ishmael and Isaac are one God, and to Him we submit. (133) (Al-Baqarah)

This scene between Jacob and his sons at the hour of death and the moments of dying is a scene of great significance.. We are facing a dying dead person.. What is the issue that occupies his mind in the hour of dying..? What thoughts cross his mind, which is preparing to slip into the throes of death? What serious matter does he want to reassure himself about before he dies? What legacy does he want to leave to his children and grandchildren? What is the thing that he wants to reassure - before his death - that it will safely reach people... all people...?

You will find the answer to all of these questions in his question (What will you worship after me). This is what preoccupies him, worries him, and is keen on in the throes of death...the issue of faith in God. It is the first and only issue, and it is the true inheritance that is not ravaged or spoiled by moths. It is an asset and a refuge.

The children of Israel said: We worship your God and the God of your fathers, Abraham, Ishmael, and Isaac, one God, and we submit to Him. The text is clear that they were sent to embrace Islam. If they departed from it, they departed from God’s mercy. And if they remained in it, mercy would reach them.

Jacob died asking his children about Islam and checking on their faith. Before his death, he was severely afflicted by his son Joseph.

Scenes from the story of Jacob, peace be upon him, will be presented with us when we mention the story of his son, the Holy Prophet Joseph, peace be upon him.
